issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: Vector allocations become a problem in sub-second cases. The pool of 8 per request is too small. Needs to be bigger -and potentially pre-populated if we can do it off the main path-.
fields.summary: LLAP: better column vector object pools

comments.body: Increasing the size of the pool. It's created inline and the vector types are only known at processing time and created by VRB utility methods inside TreeReader-s, so pre-creating CVBs would be needlessly complicated.

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12768405/HIVE-12227.patch

{color:red}ERROR:{color} -1 due to build exiting with an error
